title: Manual mode sprints
content:
For one quarter I ran in manual mode: no CI, no CD, just deliberate local builds and hand-crafted deploys. It forced me to tighten scripts and make rollbacks trivial.

The experiment exposed brittle spots places where I relied on automation to hide complexity. By fixing those, the automated path later became faster and safer.

Manual mode also reminded me to document every step. That log is now the on-call runbook.
